titleStmt.title:
Letter, Smith, H.C. in Midway, Tenn. to O.P. Temple in Knoxville, Tenn.,
1862 February 9

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, H.C. Smith in Midway, Tenn. to O.P. Temple in Knoxville, Tenn., 1862 February 9
bibl.note: In this letter, dated February 9, 1862, H.C. Smith in Midway, Tenn. writes to O.P. Temple in Knoxville, Tenn., inquiring about the "the prisoners that was convicted," his father among them. He wants to know if they have left Knoxville and, if so, what their present location is.

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Migrating from XML to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Mr O P Temple Knoxville, Tenn

Dear sir we have not leart wether the prisoners that was convicted to be sent off from Knoxville are sent or not. you will please write to me when you get this and tell me wether my father has been sent off or not and if he has where he is sent too and when he started. I send you five cents to pay the postage on the letter you will write. yours Respectfully
